entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 9:01PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain and High Water On Rivers This Week... Rain is expected from Dot Lake east to the Alcan Border on Wednesday and Thursday. Rainfall totals from 1.0 to 1.5 inches are likely with local heavier amounts in the eastern Alaska Range. Rising water levels are expected from the Alaska Range north to the Fortymile River drainage, with the risk of minor flooding in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 3:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall and Rising River Levels Again This Week... Heavy rainfall across Brooks Range and North Slope will result in rising water levels on streams and rivers. Rainfall totals around 1.0 inch are expected Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday afternoon from the Colville River near Umiat east to the Dalton Highway. Recent heavy rainfall last weekend has saturated soils in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 10:41AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Runoff from heavy rain in the Brooks Range late last week is moving down the Koyukuk River. The crest of high water is expected to reach Hughes this evening and Huslia on Thursday. High water will likely cause erosion of the riverbank at Huslia. Flooding is not expected but residents should prepare for high water and move
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
